ratings.comment: Awful teacher. Lecture was absolutely useless and discussion was similarly useless. You had to teach yourself everything. Thankfully, the text book had quite a few examples and was pretty helpful.
WORST. PROFESSOR. EVER. His exams were impossible, the second midterm average was 11/50.  I asked a question and he made me cry. Do not take this class.
Loved the course content, really disliked the professor. Made this class way harder than it needed to be.
Final was worth 35% and was impossible to do well on. 30/100 points were random word problems discussed once in class. Got a grade I didn't deserve.studied for 15+ hours got a D on the final

He is boring and explains things very poorly.  Makes tests way more difficult than they need to be, they almost have nothing to do with the homework or mandatory quizzes.  It's way too intimidating to ask him a question or to even go to his office hours.

Well he knows his stuff. He's just not all that great of a teacher ATM. I've definately had worse, and he's much better than the current alternative. His exams are not consistent. First midterm was hard, second was easy, and the final was the hardest exam I've ever laid eyes on. And I went through Kelly's econ 101 final.
He's a terrible professor. Doesn't know how to teach. Exams are extremely difficult with problems we've never gone over. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE.
If I had not taken a calculus class prior to this one, I would have been lost.  I had no idea what he was trying to explain.

David seems genuinely interested in teaching this course. He is clear for the most part, and I only found a couple lectures confusing. He is very willing to answer questions, and is not rude at all in answering them like other reviews had said. If you get a good TA and pay attention in class you should do fine.
I like this professor!!

This professor was terrible. He made everything very confusing and complicated, and I had taken calculus in high school. I often had to teach myself from the textbook because I did not understand what went on in lecture. He was an overall bad professor and I feel I didn't learn much.

Professor Diamondstone is a pretty excellent instructor. He holds great interest in math and always provide us a lot fun to learn about calculus. If you do his homework and attend lecture, you will succeed in this course. He is a responsible teacher and he cares for every student. Nice and helpful. I enjoy his lecture and have a woderful time.

I don't really understand why most people here say that he is a horrible teacher. To me, his lectures are very helpful and clear, and he really tries not to embarrass students who answer questions wrong.

Those who rate David a low score must did bad in the exams. As far as I know he is trying really hard to teach well, and he tried his best to not embarrass students when they give wrong answers. Ready to change any mistakes he made, modest and friendly. I like him and you will get an ideal score as long as you work hard

Guy is extremely smart, possibly to the point where he can't relate well with students. I had taken Calc in high school so it really helps. I assume I would be lost had I not had the previous experience. It is the guy's first year so he is still trying to figure out how hard to make the tests. He put on a huge curve once he realized it was too hard

He is an absolutely awful teacher. He makes the class much harder than it needs to be. He is very rude and disrespectful if you answer a question wrong and over explains every concept with confusing examples. He made the second mid term too hard because he thought people did too well on the first one. He is terrible. Should be fired...
Confusing way of teaching, I'm afraid to ask questions.
Not helpful in lectures. Explains things better in office hours. Class averages are so low on tests that if you go to math tutors or get help from others you will be ahead of the curve.
Horrible teacher, over explains everything and just confuses you...homework and quizzes every week and he is very bad at answering student questions
Extremely difficult to follow. He makes the class harder than it really needs to be.
Calc 211 is not a hard class but he does not know how to teach. Exams are easy and if you have a good TA your set
He isn't a bad teacher, but overly explains things. He also does not know how to answer questions. Tests (besides the 1st) are extremely hard.
over explains everything and makes easy things really confusing.
Makes class that is easy anyway very very complicated. Over explains. Tests are easy.
